title: (x) Old newspaper headline - (Monotype) Bodoni {Patricia, Mike Y}
content:
Anyone have an idea of what typeface this maybe, or a similar one that I could use to it? It's from a newspaper around the 1920s

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [DeathSpreads.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20110208144233/http:/typophile.com/files/DeathSpreads.jpg) | 255.25 KB |
author: blueanxiety

comments.content:
Looks like a Bodoni, don't have time to figure out which one.

[http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=Bodoni](http://web.archive.org/web/20110208144233/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=Bodoni "http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=Bodoni")

Based on a rather quick look I would say that Monotype Bodoni is consistent with such features as the flat-topped 't', the 'w' with no middle serif, and a somewhat compressed lower bowl on the 'g'.

- Mike Yanega
